ESP.TRADUIT: 天国先生

ESP.TRADUIT: 先锋机器人

ESP.ORIGINAL: Trap Door Key
ESP.TRADUIT: 活板门钥匙

ESP.ORIGINAL: Clearance Card: ID 451-11 [Emilius Pascal]
ESP.TRADUIT: 权限通行证：编号 451-11 [埃米利乌斯·帕斯卡尔]

ESP.ORIGINAL: Director Kang's Room Key
ESP.TRADUIT: 康主任的房间钥匙

ESP.ORIGINAL: Order of Mission
ESP.TRADUIT: 任务指令

ESP.ORIGINAL:
To my brother in faith Brigham Young,
What we came here for has finally revealed itself, but in the hands of an impious sinner known as [%].
We are talking about someone which crimes against God and all the laws of men are counted in the many, and should be punished accordingly, regardless of our little monetary-driven expedition.
I trust you, my brother, to enact a swift and godly justice upon such a wretched creature, and come back to me with the heavenly artifact in your hands.
You will block the Southern road, near the old scrapyard, and I will make sure to spread the necessary voices to draw the beast to you.
Some sources also told me that the sale of the armor will provide a much higher monetary gain that what we initially expected, enough to build a dozen churches for all of our lost brothers and sisters.
Be the one to bring me the prize, and your share will increase enough to fund a Neo-New Canaan by yourself.
The Seraphim
ESP.TRADUIT:
致信仰之兄杨百翰，
我们追寻之物终现真容，然竟落入名为 [%] 的渎神者之手。
此獠亵渎上帝、践踏人律之罪罄竹难书，纵使你我此番金钱驱动的远征本无圣战之志，亦当施以雷霆天罚。
望兄速行迅捷而神圣的审判，携天国圣器复归我处。兄可于南向公路废车场设伏，吾当散播密语引此兽入彀。
另有密报称，此甲胄之售得圣银远超预期，足以为失散弟兄姊妹兴建圣堂十二。
若兄献此圣战之礼，所获份额足以独力重建新新迦南。
——炽天使

ESP.ORIGINAL: Order of Mission
ESP.TRADUIT: 任务指令

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Odo,
Congratulations for the recent updates in your... personal situation! I抦 glad our benefactor was able to pull a few strings to... regularize everything once and for all for you.
In all case; I抳e finally found the trail of the package. It seems a Courier named [%] located then recovered it, and even found a way to make the artifact functional once again.
It抯 time for us to finish the job and relieve our friend of this burden.
I抦 going to need you to find a way to draw his attention, and convince him to hand it over to us. If not, put it out of our misery, will you?
How you rat him out is up to you: the others are idiots that need precise instructions, but you? You are a member of the Outfit, you don't need that kind of supervision.
Once everything is done, bring me the artifact. First, we regroup at the bunker, then we return West for the sale, with a juicy 75% bonus on your share.
The Seraphim
ESP.TRADUIT:
致奥多，
恭喜你的“个人问题”终于解决了！很高兴我们的赞助人动用了...一些关系，帮你彻底摆平了所有麻烦。
已经追踪到那个包裹的下落，一个叫 [%] 的邮差找到了它，甚至还让那东西运行了起来。
现在该做个了结，帮我们的朋友卸下这个负担了。
我需要你设法引起他的注意，说服他交出神器。如果不行，就直接解决掉他。
你可是组织成员，不像那些需要手把手指导的蠢货，具体方法你自己决定。
完成后带着东西回来。我们先在废弃地堡汇合，然后去西部进行交易，你能拿到比原定多75%的分成。
——炽天使

ESP.ORIGINAL: Order of Mission
ESP.TRADUIT: 任务指令

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Red Skull,
Your suffering is now going to finally come to an end, provided that you succeed in this last particular task.
The armor we seek has been recovered by some mercenary-courier known as [%], a worm you are going to eliminate for us in order to secure access to the armor.
You are to hide yourself in the Emergency Railway Station, and unleash a ghastly barrage of rockets in the surrounding valleys. I have seen the psychological effects the weapon you brought from your wretched home can do, and I plan on using it.
With enough luck, word will soon spread amongst the prospectors and our friend will pay you a visit.
Naturally, I don抰 think you are in any position to refuse me. Your prolonged absence from the Divide is affecting your skin... and bones.
In a couple of weeks, without the radiation from that cursed place, you will be nothing more than a brittle flayed skeleton... unless you are somehow able to return home.
I know a way, deep in the western mountains, but only known to two men, one of which is me.
Kill the Courier, and you will perhaps become the third keeper of such secret.
The Seraphim
ESP.TRADUIT:
致红骷髅，
若你顺利完成这最后的使命，长久折磨你的痛苦将彻底终结。
我们追寻的装甲已落入某自称 [%] 的佣兵邮差之手。消灭这条蝼蚁，拿回装甲。
你埋伏在应急铁路，用你从老家带来的那些吓人玩意儿，往周围山谷发射火箭弹制造混乱。我见识过你那武器的威慑效果，这次正好派上用场。
只要把寻宝者们都吓破胆，目标自然会被引到你跟前。
提醒你一句：离开大裂谷辐射太久，你的皮肉骨头已经开始崩解了。要是两周内回不去老家的辐射环境，你就等着变人干吧。
西边深山里有条回去的密道，现在这世上只有两个人知道，我是其中之一。杀了那个邮差，我说不定会让你当第三个知情者。
——炽天使

ESP.ORIGINAL: Order of Mission
ESP.TRADUIT: 任务指令

ESP.ORIGINAL:
My lovely Gin,
My affection for you won抰 prevent me from turning you into a dismembered pile of flesh if you don抰 stop your circus. Thought I didn抰 know?
Really Gin, ditching the mission, even temporarily, to go hunting Deathclaws? Well, if it was just that, I would have given you a pass, really.
The problem, Gin, is that you are an imbecile, and that you blackmailing and abusing the Sloan workers is a delightful information that is spreading like a wind in the Southern Mojave.
You抮e attracting unwanted attention on us and wasting time, especially when the others have all been dispatched to intercept the target.
Either you behave and move to the place I assigned you, either I抦 personally coming to take care of you and give your share to the Lord of the Turrets.
On the brighter side, remember that if you succeed in bringing me the suit, I will reach Rundas to try to fetch you a place in his Chase Collegium. Why waste such an opportunity for a petty contract with miserable miners?
The Seraphim
ESP.TRADUIT:
致我亲爱的金，
若你不立刻停止这场马戏表演，我对你的"疼爱"可不会拦着我你大卸八块。你真以为我不知情？
讲真金，放弃任务，哪怕一会儿去猎杀死亡爪？若仅如此，我或许会睁只眼闭只眼。
但问题在于，你是个蠢货，而你勒索虐待斯隆工人的"光辉事迹"，如今正像风一般传遍整个莫哈维南部。
你不仅给咱们招来不必要的关注，更在浪费宝贵时间，尤其当其他人都已出动拦截目标的时候。
要么乖乖滚去我指定的地点，要么我亲自来料理你，顺便把你的那份赏金交给炮塔之主。
不过嘛…如果成功把那套装甲带回来，我会找伦达斯活动关系，给你在追猎团谋个席位。何必为几个矿工的破合约，浪费这种飞黄腾达的机会？
——炽天使

ESP.ORIGINAL: Order of Mission
ESP.TRADUIT: 任务指令

ESP.ORIGINAL:
My dear Lord of Turrets,
There have been... recent updates regarding the job, and our newfound obstacle [%].
All my sources have confirmed me that not only the package entered in its possession, but that our dear Courier also found a way to make the tech functional once again.
The package is now likely worth the quadruple of what we initially estimated, which mean your share will increase as a result.
I want you to intercept [%] near Eastern Freeside, and take care of it so we can finally collect what we came here for. Set up a blockade near the main gate, and eliminate any merchant who try to force its way in: with enough luck, voices should soon reach our little curious friend about the disruptions, and draw our friend to you.
I have handsomely paid the Gun Runners for their non-interference, and brought a couple of Brahmins to cart off some of your 搒tationary assistants? Kill the Courier and the reward will be a 50% bonus on your share.
The Seraphim
ESP.TRADUIT:
我亲爱的炮塔之主，
关于那项任务与我们新出现的障碍——那位邮差 [%]，有些...新动态需要转告。
所有线人都已确认：不仅包裹落入其手，咱们亲爱的邮差居然还设法重启了那套科技。
如今这包裹的价值，恐怕已是当初预估的四倍有余——你的分红自然也会水涨船高。
请你在东自由城外围拦截t [%] ，彻底解决这个麻烦，好让我们回收目标。在主城门设下路障，格杀任何强行闯关的商队。运气好的话，骚动消息很快就会传到那位好奇朋友耳中，引他自投罗网。
我已重金打点军火贩子确保他们不会插手，还备了几头双头牛来搬运您那些"固定助手"。事成之后，除掉信使的奖励将额外增加50%分红。
——炽天使

ESP.ORIGINAL: Operation Order - (Classified)
ESP.TRADUIT: 行动指令（绝密）

ESP.ORIGINAL:
//Roughly translated from: Chinese\\
*PRC Official Document*
[Mission key objectives]:
- Infiltrate key enemy civilian infrastructure: Hoover Dam. - Sabotage in precise order: mother valves, ventilation pipes, backup generators, all filtration systems. Destroy if possible main drainage hole. - Investigate rumors of 揕ab 845?camoufled under the facility at Sub-Level 1C.
If leaked existence of Lab 845 is confirmed by the operation executive officer, priority is to be given to the following two objectives:
- Neutralize any possible enemy research on mutagens 56, 58 and 60. Terminate, if possible, all test subjects and prototypes. - Retrieves at all cost samples of Limit-115 bio-agent, if found in the sub-facility. Secure access to the virus and terminate operation.
[Task Force Organization]:
- Comrade Upper Officer Nao Zheng: Executive officer Equipment: Warcloak (Guanyin-Proto pattern) - Comrade Junior Officer Jiale Kang: Combat Medic Equipment: Warcloak (Hei Guei pattern) - Comrade Upper class soldier Linyu Zuang: Demolition Specialist Equipment: Warcloak (Hei Guei pattern) - Comrade Upper class soldier Xiaru Chen: Fire Role Equipment: Warcloak (Hei Guei pattern) - Comrade Upper class soldier Min Peng: Fire Role and Communication Equipment: Warcloak (Hei Guei pattern)
[Schedule]:
- Start of Operation: 08/12/2053 00:00:00, air drop over Wangliang 71, 6km South of Hoover Dam - Limit Date for Fallback: 10/12/2053 00:00:00, Burlington. A Kalinin-class fighter bomber is being assembled to evacuate team in the case Limit-115 obtained.
"Serve the People and its Republic"
ESP.TRADUIT:
//大致翻译自：中文\\
*中华人民共和国官方文件*
[任务主要目标]：
-渗透敌方主要民用基础设施：胡佛水坝。 -按顺序进行破坏：主阀，通风管道，备用发电机，所有过滤系统。尽可能破坏主要排水孔。 -调查伪装在地下1C层实验室845的传言。
如果845实验室的存在被指挥官确认，则应优先考虑以下两个目标：
-销毁所有关于诱变剂56/58/60型的研究数据，消灭所有的实验体与原型。 -不惜一切代价回收在分厂发现的限制-115生物制剂样品。管控病毒并终止行动。
[特遣队编制]：
-上校·郑挠同志：行动指挥官 装备：观音原型战甲 -中尉·康佳乐同志：战地医护 装备：黑鬼战甲 -上等兵·庄林玉同志：爆破专家 装备：黑鬼战甲 -上等兵·陈夏茹同志：火力手 装备：黑鬼战甲 -上等兵·彭敏同志：通讯/火力支援 装备：黑鬼战甲
[行动时间表]:
-空降阶段：2053年12月8日 00:00，着陆坐标：胡佛大坝以南6公里"魍魉71区" -撤退期限：2053年12月10日 00:00，伯灵顿机场待命的列宁级轰炸机，以便在获得限制-115的情况下撤离小组。
“为了人民和共和国”

ESP.ORIGINAL: You're sunk, Cousteau
ESP.TRADUIT: 沉船吧，库斯托

ESP.ORIGINAL:
My dear Cousteau,
Taking me for an imbecile, aren抰 we? Thought you could fuck me over? Really?
I抦 quite disappointed with that little trick you pulled, old friend. You know very well WHO I抦 working for and why I brought you along, and yet, you decided to ride solo.
Your men found what I was looking for. I have my own ways to know There was a deal, Cousteau. A simple one really.
Our old friendship doesn抰 protect you from my principles. You抮e going down with your boat, dear Captain.
The Seraphim
ESP.TRADUIT:
我亲爱的库斯托：
真把我当傻子耍了，嗯？以为能把我坑了？当真？
老朋友，我对你耍的小把戏很失望。你明明清楚我为 谁 效力，也明白我为何带你入局，可你偏要单干。
你的人找到了我要的东西——我自有办法确认消息。 咱们有过约定，库斯托，原本是桩简单的交易。
旧日情分护不住你。等着和你的破船一起沉没吧，亲爱的船长。
炽天使 敬上

ESP.ORIGINAL: Deal's Changed
ESP.TRADUIT: 交易变了

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Bass,
Don抰 play the idiot with me. Don't.
I know very well the true reasons why Khagan hired me, despite your little efforts to distill the informations passed down to me. Surprised, eh?
K. doesn抰 care for that prostitute invisibility cape you call a Stealth Suit. Nor does anyone else in the entire fucking Syndicate, am I right?
What he is REALLY after is what he thinks could be found hidden in the circuitry of that thing.
I was the one who brought him the Pre-War records about the eruption of the Blue Sickness.
You weren抰 even in the fucking business at that time, around 8 years ago, when he sent me down to investigate the Dam, well before the NCR stuck their nose in it.
There were three vials of Limit-115 stored at the Dam at the dusk of the Old World, before the Chinese came for them. Two made it to Denver and broke, unleashing the plague, and the last one disappeared from records.
Khagan spent his youth searching for it, dreaming of getting his hands on this death reaper, only resigning himself after accepting that the last vial was probably lost to the Colorado.
But the old man is getting senile, isn抰 he? Once that Chase Collegium抯 moron told him about the Lakelurks concentration just South of the Dam, his mind did two plus two together, and he now has this fantasy that the third vial was broken there, and upon mixing with the water, mutated the native turtles into Lakelurk...
And now? Well now he thinks that something in that suit may have some... details, some clues about... others secrets Labs where Limit-115 could still be hidden and that the Chinese were also preparing to raid.
So now you better take, like you say, 搕hat little subsonic pistol of yours?and go tell him I know his little convoluted plan and that I don抰 work for scraps.
That Courier called [%], 揝tealthtenza? has not just 搃ntercepted?the Suit, but went as a far as claiming it as a prize, before taking care of all my men. This also includes Scorseny, which should I remind you all, is, like us, a member of the Outfit.
Tell Khagan that either the Syndicate quadruples the reward, either he provides me with a fresh crew. If he isn抰 willing to pay extra, I swear that once I take care of [%], I抦 going to unload Angel Eyes on any surviving electronics of that Suit.
That way, he can definitely say farewell to this unique and slim chance at ever gettings his crooked hands on Limit-115.
The choice is entirely his now.
The Seraphim
ESP.TRADUIT:
致低音
别他妈跟我装傻。别！
我很清楚可汗雇佣我的真实原因——尽管你费尽心机过滤传给我的情报。意外吗？
整个组织没人在乎你那婊子养的隐身服（包括可汗），对吧？
他真正想要的，是那套装备电路里可能藏着的东西。
八年前（那时你还没入行），是我带着战前关于"蓝死病"爆发的记录找上他。
在NCR还没插手时，他就派我调查过大坝。
旧世界末期有三管限制-115曾储存在那里。中国人抢走前，两管运到丹佛后破裂引发瘟疫，最后一管则从记录里消失了。
可汗年轻时疯狂寻找这管死神药剂，直到认命它可能已沉没在科罗拉多河底。
但如今这老家伙老糊涂了，自从追猎团那个白痴告诉他大坝南边的湖沼蟹异常聚集，他就幻想第三管药剂在那儿破裂，把普通乌龟变异成了湖沼蟹...
现在？他猜那套装甲里可能藏着线索，指向其他可能藏有限制-115的秘密实验室，是中国人当年也想突袭的地方。
所以你现在最好拎着那把你吹嘘的"亚音速手枪"，去告诉他： 老子看穿了他弯弯绕绕的计划 老子不接残羹剩饭的活儿
那个叫 [%]的邮差不仅"截获"了装甲，还把它当战利品占为己有，顺便宰了我所有人，包括咱们组织的斯科尔塞尼。
最后通牒： 要么组织把赏金翻四倍 要么给我补充人手 要是他连这点代价都不愿付...等我解决 [%]后，会用"天使之眼"把装甲残骸烧得连电路板都不剩——让他永远断了对限制-115的念想。
选择权在他手上。
——炽天使

ESP.ORIGINAL: Presidential Pardon
ESP.TRADUIT: 总统的赦免

ESP.ORIGINAL:
[On my authority as President of New California Republic]
To all to whom these presents shall come, greetings:
WHEREAS M. Odo Romello Scorseny, having been convicted on the fourth of July 2248 by the State of Maxson Military Court for:
- complicity in attempted genocide - association with the Enclave terror organization as a commanding junior officer - assassination of esteemed Brotherhood of Steel allies and sedition against the State - participation in the brutal liberation of Enclave-backed criminals
AND WHEREAS M. Odo Romello Scorseny has demonstrated rehabilitation, remorse, and a commitment in becoming a positive contributor to society, notably by, but not only:
- serving for a duration of 15 years as a commando training instructor for the NCR Ranger Program - revolutionizing the field of demolition terror warfare on the behalf of the NCR Sapper Program - highly distinguishing himself as a key operative during Operation Diamond
AND WHEREAS it is the policy of this administration to encourage and recognize efforts toward redemption, forgiveness, and societal reintegration;
NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT RESOLVED that, by the authority vested in me as President of NCR, I hereby grant to Odo Romello Scorseny a full and unconditional pardon for the offenses stated above.
This pardon removes all legal disabilities and penalties arising from said convictions and restores all rights, privileges, and immunities enjoyed prior to the convictions, alongside a 800 NCR dollars/month military pension.
IN TESTIMONY WHEREOF, I have hereunto set my hand and caused the Seal of the President of NCR to be affixed.
Done in Shady Sands, on January the fifth 2281.
Aaron Kimball President of the New California Republic
Attested by:
Judge Cry Judge Smith Judge Richter Judge Purton
ESP.TRADUIT:
新加州共和国总统特赦令
所有收到这些礼物的人，向您问候：
鉴于 被告奥多·罗梅洛·斯科尔塞尼于2248年7月4日经马克森军事法庭裁定犯有以下罪行：
-种族灭绝未遂同谋罪 -以初级指挥官身份勾结英克雷恐怖组织 -刺杀钢铁兄弟会盟友及危害国家叛乱罪 -参与暴力解救英克雷庇护罪犯行动
且鉴于 该犯在服刑期间表现出显著悔过与改造意愿，包括但不限于：
-担任NCR游骑兵突击队教官15年（革新了爆破战术体系） -在"钻石行动"中作为关键特工立下战功 -对NCR工兵部队的反恐作战理论作出革命性贡献
现根据本政府 "鼓励赎罪与社会再融合"之政策精神，我——新加州共和国总统亚伦·金博尔——依据宪法赋予之权力，对斯科尔塞尼所涉全部罪行予以无条件特赦。
赦免效力 免除一切由上述定罪产生的法律限制及处罚 恢复其公民全部权利、特权及豁免权 授予每月800 NCR元的退役军人津贴 文书认证 （以下附总统签名及国玺印鉴）
亚伦·金博尔 新加州共和国总统，2281年1月5日于沙荫市签署
联署法官： 克莱丨史密斯丨里克特丨珀顿

ESP.ORIGINAL: Stop the booze, Red
ESP.TRADUIT: 别喝了，红

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Red,
For the love of anything you want: QUIT THAT HABIT.
I know that the longer you remain separated from your little "ecosystem" from beyond the moutains, the more you're falling apart, but trust me, downing a dozen irradiated pints per day isn't the right call.
Yeah juicing yourself with Rad-booze can help handle that a bit, but don't you see the downsides?
You're drunk any hour of the fucking year, and the boss is taking advantage of that, without you realizing it. He is sending you left and right again and again, extending your contract without bonuses, while holding you by the balls that he won't share with you that "secret passage" for you to get back home.
You need to confront him about that. SOBER.
Come on man, you promised me we would go hunt Deathclaws together in your region, once all of this is over...
Your only friend in that crew of bitches and assholes.
Gin
ESP.TRADUIT:
致红
看在任何你在乎的东西份上：戒掉那破习惯！
我知道你离了山那边那个"小生态圈"越久，状态就越糟...但相信我，每天灌十几杯辐射酒绝不是解决办法。
是，用辐射酒精麻痹自己确实能缓解症状，但你就没发现副作用吗？
你他妈全年醉醺醺，老板正利用这点耍你呢，他反复派你东奔西跑，不断延长合同却不加奖金，还用那条"秘密回家通道"当诱饵吊着你。
你得清醒着去跟他摊牌。
伙计，你可是答应过等这一切结束，要带我去你老家一起猎杀死亡爪的...
——在这群贱人堆里唯一把你当朋友的 金

ESP.ORIGINAL: Translated Broadcast
ESP.TRADUIT: 翻译广播

ESP.ORIGINAL:
//Roughly translated from: Chinese\\
Emission Date: [Corrupted]
"Zheng... If you receive this radio loop, it means G.U.A.N.Y.I.N still operates. That means you made it. Somehow."
"I抎 say I抦 surprised, but I抦 not. You always had a way of being favored by fate.?
"Wangliang 71 is still there. If you remember anything, you know what it means, and if you care at all, you抣l come."
"Maybe it抯 regrets. Maybe it抯 just duty. Either way, you抣l find what抯 left of me there."
"See you soon, Company Commander."
\\This transmission will repeat//
ESP.TRADUIT:
//大致翻译自：中文\\
发射日期：[数据损坏]
“老郑...如果你还能收到这个无线电信号。那就说明观音还在运作，我其实很惊讶，但又没那么惊讶。你一直都是被佛祖保佑的内个“
“魍魉71号还在。如果你还记得，那你肯定知道这代表什么，如果你在意的话，你会来的。”
可能是遗憾，或者只是出于职责，总之，你能在那儿找到我剩下的一切。
再见了啊，连长。
※本讯息将重复※

ESP.ORIGINAL: Secret Tape from: Odo Scorseny
ESP.TRADUIT: 秘密录音带来自：奥多·斯科尔塞尼

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Gin,
The Lord of Turrets apparently ran another set of simulations, and she has come to a certain conclusion: even if us three team up and set up a perfect ambush, our chances at taking down The Seraphim are below 34%.
Worse, I think I figured out what抯 that weird gadget of his he claimed to have found, "by chance" in the bunker.
It抯 some kind of Particle Shield Generator: top notch but niche Pre-War tech, even better than what the Enclave had back in the day. It's not by mistake he had us repurpose that old Poseidon Energy's Research Center for our fallback point.
We are talking about highly instable stuff, yeah, but we would still need the firepower of a small army to even hope for the shield to collapse on itself. I'm also suspecting he has done more than just repaint the bots of the facility...
Us three is not enough, but who else?
Brigham? That disgusting mutant has not other trick in his sleeves than preaching about God抯 Will to justify his "resurrections" as anything more than a nauseous healing factor.
Red Skull? I know you are fond of this?aberration, but given his condition, he is more likely to dissolve into a puddle of radioactive goo than be of any use in the fight.
On the brighter side, there抯 been?talks. Our REAL employer is getting tired of The Seraphim抯 whims, and it is only a matter of time before the ship sinks.
Once we deal with [%] and recover the Chinese trinket, things will get ugly for the boss and we will get the perfect opportunity to strike back, perhaps even with reinforcements.
Better to bide our time than getting blasted to pieces by his "Angel Eyes" should the bastard finds out.
Scorseny
ESP.TRADUIT:
金，
"炮塔之主显然又运行了一次模拟战局，她得出了结论：即便我们三人联手设下完美埋伏，击杀炽天使的成功率仍低于34%。"
"更糟的是，我想我破译了他在掩体里“偶然”发现的那个古怪装置，某种粒子护盾发生器，顶尖但冷门的战前科技，甚至比当年英克雷的装备更先进。难怪他让我们把海神能源研究中心改造成撤退据点。"
"虽然这技术极不稳定，但我们需要一支小型军队的火力才可能让护盾过载。我怀疑他还改造了研究中心的机器人..."
"我们三人不够，但还能找谁？"
"百翰？那个恶心的变种人除了用“上帝旨意”美化他恶心的再生能力外，一无是处。"
"红骷髅？我知道你喜欢这个...异变体，但他更可能融成一滩放射性黏液而非派上用场。"
"好消息是，有风声传来，真正的雇主已厌倦炽天使的任性，他的覆灭只是时间问题。"
"等我们处理掉 [%] 并回收中国遗物后，局势会剧变，那将是我们反击的最佳时机，或许还能获得增援。"
"宁可等待时机，也别被那混蛋的“天使之眼”轰成碎片。"
——斯科尔塞尼

ESP.ORIGINAL: Little Red Book
ESP.TRADUIT: 毛泽东语录

ESP.ORIGINAL:
[...]
"A revolution is not a dinner party, nor an essay, nor a painting, nor embroidery; it cannot be so refined, so leisurely and gentle, so temperate, kind, courteous, restrained, and magnanimous.
A revolution is an insurrection, an act of violence by which one class overthrows another. The seizure of power by armed force, the settlement of the issue by war, is the central task and the highest form of revolution.
This Marxist-Leninist principle of revolution holds good universally, for China and for all other countries. If we have shortcomings, we are not afraid to have them pointed out and criticized because we serve the people.
Anyone, no matter who, may point out our shortcomings. If he is right, we will correct them. If what he proposes will benefit the people, we will act upon it. The world is yours, as well as ours, but in the last analysis, it is yours.
You young people, full of vigor and vitality, are in the bloom of life, like the sun at eight or nine in the morning. Hope rests in you. The future belongs to you!"
[...]
ESP.TRADUIT:
[...]
"革命不是请客吃饭，不是做文章，不是绘画绣花，不能那样雅致，那样从容不迫，文质彬彬，那样温良恭俭让。革命是暴动，是一个阶级推翻一个阶级的暴烈的行动。
革命的中心任务和最高形式是武装夺取政权，是战争解决问题。这个马克思列宁主义的革命原则是普遍地对的，不论在中国在外国，一概都是对的。
因为我们是为人民服务的，所以，我们如果有缺点，就不怕别人批评指出。不管是什么人，谁向我们指出都行。
世界是你们的，也是我们的，但是归根结底是你们的。你们青年人朝气蓬勃，正在兴旺时期，好像早晨八九点钟的太阳。希望寄托在你们身上。"
**译者注：作者原文分段错的一塌糊涂**
原文： "A revolution is not a dinner party, nor an essay, nor a painting, nor embroidery; it cannot be so refined, so leisurely and gentle, so temperate, kind, courteous, restrained, and magnanimous.
A revolution is an insurrection, an act of violence by which one class overthrows another. The seizure of power by armed force, the settlement of the issue by war, is the central task and the highest form of revolution.
This Marxist-Leninist principle of revolution holds good universally, for China and for all other countries. If we have shortcomings, we are not afraid to have them pointed out and criticized because we serve the people.
Anyone, no matter who, may point out our shortcomings. If he is right, we will correct them. If what he proposes will benefit the people, we will act upon it. The world is yours, as well as ours, but in the last analysis, it is yours.
You young people, full of vigor and vitality, are in the bloom of life, like the sun at eight or nine in the morning. Hope rests in you. The future belongs to you!"
[...]

ESP.ORIGINAL:
[...]
"The cold winds rage, the sky looms heavy, yet upon the mountain抯 crest, the plum blossom stands alone, its fragrance unyielding against the frost. Unafraid, it blossoms in defiance of winter抯 tyranny, heralding the arrival of a new spring, a dawn yet unseen.
The plum does not bend to hardship nor falter beneath the snow抯 cruel weight. Against all odds, it flourishes, its petals a whisper of perseverance, its scent a testament to unshaken resolve. In times of great adversity, one must look to the plum; its nature is the essence of revolution, the soul of struggle.
Strength is not merely in the sword, nor in the words of men, but in the silent endurance of a flower blooming amidst the storm.
If one seeks a symbol of resilience, let them gaze upon the plum blossom, for in its solitary beauty, it teaches the lessons of time: suffering breeds strength, hardship refines spirit, and patience rewards those who endure."
[...]
ESP.TRADUIT:
[...]
风雨送春归，飞雪迎春到。已是悬崖百丈冰，犹有花枝俏。 俏也不争春，只把春来报。待到山花烂漫时，她在丛中笑。
**译者注：以下是作者原文和翻译，不清楚作者看的是哪一版的咏梅**
原文： "The cold winds rage, the sky looms heavy, yet upon the mountain抯 crest, the plum blossom stands alone, its fragrance unyielding against the frost. Unafraid, it blossoms in defiance of winter抯 tyranny, heralding the arrival of a new spring, a dawn yet unseen.
The plum does not bend to hardship nor falter beneath the snow抯 cruel weight. Against all odds, it flourishes, its petals a whisper of perseverance, its scent a testament to unshaken resolve. In times of great adversity, one must look to the plum; its nature is the essence of revolution, the soul of struggle.
Strength is not merely in the sword, nor in the words of men, but in the silent endurance of a flower blooming amidst the storm.
If one seeks a symbol of resilience, let them gaze upon the plum blossom, for in its solitary beauty, it teaches the lessons of time: suffering breeds strength, hardship refines spirit, and patience rewards those who endure."
翻译：
朔风怒号，天幕低垂，然山巅之上，寒梅独放，幽香凌霜不折。无畏严冬之暴虐，傲然绽蕊，昭示未见之春晓。"
"梅不屈于艰厄，不折于雪虐。逆势而盛，其瓣为坚忍之低语，其香为不屈之明证。大劫临头，当观梅品性，此乃革命之精魄，抗争之魂灵。"
"刚毅非独存于剑刃，亦非囿于人之豪言，而在于风暴中静默绽放之花。"
"若寻坚韧之象征，且观寒梅：其孤绝之美，暗喻光阴真谛，苦难铸就筋骨，艰险淬炼神魂，而忍耐终将馈赠持久之人。
[...]

ESP.ORIGINAL:
[...]
"The Long March was a manifesto. It was a propaganda force. It was a seeding machine. It has sown many seeds which will sprout, grow, and bear fruit, and they will yield a harvest in the years to come.
The Red Army was like a great dragon; wherever it passed, the people awakened, the earth trembled, and the ruling classes feared its very shadow. We faced starvation, the treacherous rivers, the towering peaks, the endless wilderness, the constant ambush of the enemy. We crossed rivers on rafts, scaled mountains with ropes, and marched through snow and ice with bleeding feet.
But we did not stop. The struggle was bitter, but our belief was unshaken. We knew that beyond the hardship lay the future we fought for a future not for ourselves alone, but for the people. Through hardship, we were tempered. Through loss, we found unity. Through endless nights of hunger and cold, we understood the cost of revolution.
The Long March was more than a military retreat; it was a pilgrimage, a test of endurance, and above all, a lesson: the path to victory is carved with perseverance and sacrifice."
[...]
ESP.TRADUIT:
[...]
**译者注：以下是作者原文和翻译，不清楚作者看的哪一版长征**
翻译： 长征是一篇宣言书，一支宣传队，一台播种机。它撒下的种子将在未来破土、生长、结果，终将迎来丰收的季节。
红军犹如一条巨龙：所经之处，人民觉醒，大地震颤，统治阶级闻风丧胆。我们面对饥饿的威胁，跨越诡谲的江河，翻越巍峨的雪峰，穿越无垠的荒原，时刻警惕敌人的伏击。我们乘木筏渡急流，系绳索攀绝壁，踏着鲜血浸透的草鞋行走在冰天雪地之中。
但我们从未停步。斗争是残酷的，但信念从未动摇。我们深知，越过艰险便是为之奋斗的未来——那不仅是属于我们的未来，更是属于人民的未来。苦难锤炼了我们，牺牲凝聚了我们，在饥寒交迫的无尽长夜里，我们领悟了革命的代价。
长征不只是一次军事转移，更是一场精神的朝圣、一次意志的考验，而最重要的是它揭示的真理：胜利之路，由坚持与牺牲铸就。
原文： "The Long March was a manifesto. It was a propaganda force. It was a seeding machine. It has sown many seeds which will sprout, grow, and bear fruit, and they will yield a harvest in the years to come.
The Red Army was like a great dragon; wherever it passed, the people awakened, the earth trembled, and the ruling classes feared its very shadow. We faced starvation, the treacherous rivers, the towering peaks, the endless wilderness, the constant ambush of the enemy. We crossed rivers on rafts, scaled mountains with ropes, and marched through snow and ice with bleeding feet.
But we did not stop. The struggle was bitter, but our belief was unshaken. We knew that beyond the hardship lay the future we fought for a future not for ourselves alone, but for the people. Through hardship, we were tempered. Through loss, we found unity. Through endless nights of hunger and cold, we understood the cost of revolution.
The Long March was more than a military retreat; it was a pilgrimage, a test of endurance, and above all, a lesson: the path to victory is carved with perseverance and sacrifice."
[...]

ESP.ORIGINAL:
[...]
"In the dim glow of the lanterns, the courtesan抯 laughter echoed through the chamber, mingling with the scent of incense and the murmurs of weary poets. Jin Wenqing, a man once bound by noble ambition, now found himself lost in the languid haze of pleasure and ruin.
The city was alive, a beast of excess, devouring the souls of those who lingered too long in its grasp. The walls of the pleasure house whispered secrets of power and betrayal, of love traded for silver, of dignity crumbling beneath the weight of indulgence.
Yet, amidst the decadence, there was a sadness, an awareness that this world was fleeting, that beauty itself was but an illusion cast upon the waves of time."
[...]
ESP.TRADUIT:
[...]
**译者注：以下是作者原文和翻译，不清楚作者看的哪一版孽海花**
翻译： 灯笼的幽光里，妓馆的笑声混着熏香与倦怠诗人的低语，在厅堂间回荡。金雯青——这个曾被壮志束缚的男人，如今沉溺于纵欲与堕落的迷障中。
整座城市犹如贪婪的巨兽，将盘桓太久者的灵魂尽数吞噬。欢场的墙垣窃窃诉说着权力与背叛的秘密：爱情如何被白银交易，尊严如何在放纵的重压下瓦解。
然而在这颓靡之中，却透着一丝哀伤。人们心知肚明，这浮华世界不过转瞬即逝，所谓美丽，亦只是时光长河上的一场幻影。
原文： "In the dim glow of the lanterns, the courtesan抯 laughter echoed through the chamber, mingling with the scent of incense and the murmurs of weary poets. Jin Wenqing, a man once bound by noble ambition, now found himself lost in the languid haze of pleasure and ruin.
The city was alive, a beast of excess, devouring the souls of those who lingered too long in its grasp. The walls of the pleasure house whispered secrets of power and betrayal, of love traded for silver, of dignity crumbling beneath the weight of indulgence.
Yet, amidst the decadence, there was a sadness, an awareness that this world was fleeting, that beauty itself was but an illusion cast upon the waves of time."
[...]

ESP.ORIGINAL:
[...]
"Ah Q had no surname. He was simply Ah Q, a name thrown upon him by those who neither cared for nor remembered his true origins. He was a man of contradictions, boasting in the face of humiliation, laughing at his own misfortunes, convincing himself that defeat was victory.
Whenever he was beaten, he would walk away, shaking his head, muttering, 'What does it matter? I still win in my heart!' And so, he lived, a man clinging to illusions, a survivor not by strength but by self-deception. The village laughed at him, yet they, too, were prisoners of a decaying world, bound by the same cycle of oppression and resignation.
Ah Q抯 fate was sealed not by a grand betrayal, but by the slow, grinding weight of a system that consumed men like him without thought."
[...]
ESP.TRADUIT:
[...]
**译者注：以下是作者原文和翻译，不清楚作者看的哪一版精简阿Q**
译文： 阿Q是没有姓的。人们随意赏他一个"阿Q"的称呼，既懒得追究他的本家，也记不起他真正的来历。他是个矛盾的集合体——挨了打便夸耀自己的"胜利"，遭了灾反要嘲笑自己的"高明"，明明吃了亏，偏要自欺欺人地认定是占了便宜。
每回被人揍了，他便摇头晃脑地走开，嘴里嘟囔着："儿子打老子，算什么东西！"如此这般活着，全靠着精神胜利法吊住一口气。未庄的人们笑他，可他们何尝不是困在腐朽世道里的囚徒？不过是被同样的压迫与麻木捆住了手脚。
阿Q的末路并非毁于什么惊天阴谋，而是被那个吃人不吐骨头的旧社会，一点一点碾碎了魂灵。
原文： "Ah Q had no surname. He was simply Ah Q, a name thrown upon him by those who neither cared for nor remembered his true origins. He was a man of contradictions, boasting in the face of humiliation, laughing at his own misfortunes, convincing himself that defeat was victory.
Whenever he was beaten, he would walk away, shaking his head, muttering, 'What does it matter? I still win in my heart!' And so, he lived, a man clinging to illusions, a survivor not by strength but by self-deception. The village laughed at him, yet they, too, were prisoners of a decaying world, bound by the same cycle of oppression and resignation.
Ah Q抯 fate was sealed not by a grand betrayal, but by the slow, grinding weight of a system that consumed men like him without thought."
[...]

ESP.ORIGINAL:
[...]
"Fang Hongjian stared at the diploma in his hands, its Latin words holding the weight of years wasted in foreign classrooms. He had returned to China with high hopes, yet every job interview ended in mockery: his "European education" was a fraud, a passport to nowhere.
In Shanghai, intellectuals gossiped behind teacups, spinning words into meaningless webs of sophistication. He married Sun Roujia, thinking companionship would shield him from loneliness. Instead, the walls of their home became a battlefield, each word another volley in a war neither could win. Love had faded into dull contempt, a siege where surrender felt as futile as resistance.
Life, it seemed, was a fortress besieged: escape brought no relief, only the realization that the outside was just as unbearable as the inside."
[...]
ESP.TRADUIT:
[...]
**译者注：以下是作者原文和翻译，不清楚作者看的哪一版围城Q**
翻译： 方鸿渐盯着手中文凭，那些拉丁文字母压着四年海外课堂虚度的光阴。他怀揣希望回到中国，每次求职却终成笑柄——所谓"欧洲文凭"不过是张无处落脚的假通行证。
上海滩的知识分子们端着茶盏搬弄是非，把言语织成毫无意义的精致蛛网。他娶了孙柔嘉，原以为婚姻能抵御孤独，谁知家中白墙化作战场，每句话都成了两败俱伤的流弹。爱情早褪成钝刀割肉般的嫌恶，这场围城里，投降与抵抗同样徒劳。
人生仿佛一座围城：逃出来才发觉，城外煎熬与城内苦楚，原来不分伯仲。
原文： "Fang Hongjian stared at the diploma in his hands, its Latin words holding the weight of years wasted in foreign classrooms. He had returned to China with high hopes, yet every job interview ended in mockery: his "European education" was a fraud, a passport to nowhere.
In Shanghai, intellectuals gossiped behind teacups, spinning words into meaningless webs of sophistication. He married Sun Roujia, thinking companionship would shield him from loneliness. Instead, the walls of their home became a battlefield, each word another volley in a war neither could win. Love had faded into dull contempt, a siege where surrender felt as futile as resistance.
Life, it seemed, was a fortress besieged: escape brought no relief, only the realization that the outside was just as unbearable as the inside."
[...]

ESP.ORIGINAL:
[...]
"Inspector Chen sipped his tea, staring at the dossier before him. Another case of corruption, another official who had fled abroad with a fortune stolen from the people. The whispers of justice barely stirred the stagnant air of Shanghai, drowned out by the machinery of power and silence.
His orders were clear: investigate Xing Xing, a high-ranking official rumored to have fled to Los Angeles. But Chen knew better than to believe in simple answers. A case like this would lead him down a labyrinth of deceit: party connections, personal betrayals, money flowing through unseen channels.
He would have to read between the lines, navigate a world where truth was a dangerous thing to uncover. The city stretched before him, a tangled web of neon and shadows.
Somewhere in that maze, the real criminals moved freely, knowing that justice was, at best, an illusion."
[...]
ESP.TRADUIT:
[...]
**译者注：以下是作者原文和翻译，不清楚作者看的哪一版双城案**
翻译： 陈探长啜着茶，目光落在案卷上。又是一起贪腐案，又一位卷走民脂民官逃往海外的官员。正义的微澜在这潭上海滩的死水里激不起波纹，早被权力的机器与沉默碾得粉碎。
上级命令很明确：调查疑似潜逃洛杉矶的高官邢星。但老练如他，深知这类案件只会通向谎言的迷宮——党羽勾连、私人背叛、资金在暗渠中奔涌。
他必须解读字缝里的真相，在这个"知道得越多越危险"的世界里周旋。窗外城市铺展如霓虹与阴影交织的蛛网，而真正的罪犯正在这迷宮某处自由穿行，他们心知肚明：所谓正义，不过是个易碎的幻觉。
原文： "Inspector Chen sipped his tea, staring at the dossier before him. Another case of corruption, another official who had fled abroad with a fortune stolen from the people. The whispers of justice barely stirred the stagnant air of Shanghai, drowned out by the machinery of power and silence.
His orders were clear: investigate Xing Xing, a high-ranking official rumored to have fled to Los Angeles. But Chen knew better than to believe in simple answers. A case like this would lead him down a labyrinth of deceit: party connections, personal betrayals, money flowing through unseen channels.
He would have to read between the lines, navigate a world where truth was a dangerous thing to uncover. The city stretched before him, a tangled web of neon and shadows.
Somewhere in that maze, the real criminals moved freely, knowing that justice was, at best, an illusion."
[...]

Please, wait for the track to play till the end before selecting another Sincerely, Comrade Lucian
PS: Playing two or more tracks at the same time really damage the speakers of the Model 207, we already talked about that. Anyone I catch doing that despite my memo and my numerous warnings will be assigned to paint the next three batchs of Vanguardists, ALONE.

ESP.ORIGINAL:
TOP SECRET
Strategic Operations Unit Field Report: Operation Underdam Filed: 10/12/2053 Location filed: Wangliang 71 Report Author: Comrade Junior Officer Jiale Kang, Combat Medic Mission Status: Compromised
MISSION REPORT: Planned infiltration of enemy facility: Hoover Dam achieved under the cover of darkness. Initial objectives were executed flawlessly: mother valves, ventilation pipes, and filtration systems were sabotaged in quick successive order. During this phase, no enemy forces detected our presence.
At hour 3 of the operation, attempts to locate the main drainage hole of the Dam resulted in the discovery of a secret facility at Sub-Level 1C, confirming the existence of the rumored Lab 845. Team infiltrated the lower facility by using our Warcloak textile to evade laser security.
Lab 845抯 affiliation with the U.S Army Bio-technical Research Division has been confirmed: various grotesque biological experiments created through mutations beyond rational comprehension were identified and terminated by the squad. Among others findings were samples of Limit-115, the confirmed bioweapon we were tipped about, with the squad securing three vials for exfiltration. [More details in the Limit-115 Report]
LOSSES & EXTRACTION FAILURE: At hour 4 of the operation, security systems flagged our incursion, with an abnormally large garrison swarming the place in the matter of minutes. In a desperate attempt to quickly terminate enemy research, CD-42-R24 was attacked and killed by one of the mutants, severing our communication link at hour 5. Chaos ensued as the rest of the squad scattered in an attempt to reach fallback points.
CD-07-I11 retrieved one vial and exited the facility but remains missing in action. CD-89-R06 and CD-42-R12 abandoned their Hei Guei Warcloak within the dam itself, stealing U.S. military uniforms to facilitate their escape with their vials. Despite their tactical maneuvering, they were identified in Denver at hour 10 and executed at hour 13 of the operation.
I, CD-54-R84 Jiale Kang, managed to reach Wangliang 71, the nearest secure underground network for our forces, where I now submit this report. I remain the sole surviving member capable of relaying mission intelligence.
STRATEGIC FAILURES & ENEMY COUNTERMEASURES: - Underestimated Security Systems: The U.S. military抯 surveillance and defensive infrastructure were more advanced than anticipated, with advanced laser screening and disruptions fields being barely evadable thanks to the advancements of the Warcloak Program
- Unexpected Biological Threats: Lab 845抯 experiments were uncontrolled and highly lethal, leading to CD-42-R24抯 brutal death and mission disruption. Advancements of enemy research in the mutation field is alarming high: countermeasures need to be prepared to handle the enemy抯 Bio-technical Research Division assets.
- Loss of Coordination: With CD-42-R24 gone, operational cohesion quickly disintegrated, leading to the failure of planned exfiltration routes.
- Hostile Engagement & Fallout: The discovery of Limit-115 and release of the 揘ew Plague?has likely triggered high-alert status within the U.S. territory, reducing the window for any future operations.
FINAL DIRECTIVESS & RECOMMENDATIONS: - Immediate efforts must be made to locate CD-07-I11 Nao Zheng and retrieve his vial of Limit-115 before U.S. forces do.
- Further operations targeting Lab 845 must reconsider direct infiltration in favor of long-range sabotage.
- The U.S. government抯 biological warfare projects pose a severe threat to global stability. High command must prioritize countermesures, I insist.
- As the sole survivor, I await further orders. Current priority is remaining undetected and relaying intelligence back to Command.
Despite our losses, we have confirmed the existence of U.S. bioweapon facilities at Sub Level 1C and undermined the capitalist victory through the unexpected mass outbreak brought by the sacrifice of CD-89-R06 and CD-42-R12.
END REPORT
ESP.TRADUIT:
绝密
战略行动组野战报告：坝下行动 归档日期：2053年10月12日 归档地点：魍魉71基地 报告人：康佳乐少尉同志，负责战地医疗 任务状态：已暴露
行动简报： 成功借助夜色掩护渗透胡佛大坝敌设施。初期目标完美执行：先后破坏主阀门、通风管道及过滤系统，此阶段未触发敌军警报。
行动第3小时，在定位大坝主排水口时，于1C子层发现代号845实验室的秘密设施。小队利用"黑鬼"战袍光学迷彩突破激光防线潜入。
该实验室隶属美军生物技术研究部，发现多例超出认知的突变生物实验体（已清除），缴获三管限制-115（即情报提及的生物武器样本，详见专项报告）
伤亡与撤离失败： 行动第4小时触发安防系统，敌军以异常速度集结。在紧急销毁敌研究资料时： CD-42-R24（彭敏）遭突变体袭击阵亡，导致通讯中断（第5小时） CD-07-I11（郑挠）携带一管样本突围，目前处于失联状态 CD-89-R06（陈夏茹）与 CD-42-R12（庄林玉）弃置战甲伪装美军逃脱，但在丹佛遭识别处决（第13小时） 本员CD-54-R84（康佳乐）最终抵达魍魉71基地，系目前唯一具备情报回传能力的幸存者。
战略失误与敌情分析： - 安防系统低估： 美军激光扫描/干扰场技术远超预期，"黑鬼"战甲仅勉强规避
- 生物威胁失控： 实验室突变体致死率极高，直接导致任务崩坏 需紧急制定针对敌生物技术部的反制方案
- 协同失效： 通讯专员阵亡后，撤离计划完全瓦解
- 战略暴露： 限制-115样本的泄漏及"新瘟疫"，可能引发美军全域戒严
最终指令与建议： - 优先级任务： 抢在美军前定位郑挠并回收样本
- 战术调整： 放弃对845实验室的直接渗透，改用远程破坏手段
- 战略预警： 提请中央军委高度重视敌生物武器研发进度
- 幸存者状态： 本员将继续潜伏并保持情报传输通道
行动总结： 尽管损失惨重，但确认了1C子层生物武器设施的存在，且CD-89-R06（陈夏茹）与 CD-42-R12（庄林玉）的牺牲意外引发大规模疫情，客观上削弱了资本主义阵营的战争潜力。
报告结束

ESP.ORIGINAL:
TOP SECRET
Strategic Operations Unit Supplementary Report: Limit-115 Analysis Filed: 20/12/2053 Location filed: Wangliang 71 Report Author: Comrade Junior Officer Jiale Kang, Combat Medic
PRELIMINARY FINDINGS ON LIMIT-115: Despite the loss of all captured vials, the squad had enough time to examine key schematics and data logs in Lab 845 regarding Limit-115, the new biological agent engineered by the US Bio-technical Research Division under classified directives. The pathogen exhibits characteristics designed for rapid population destabilization and long-term genetic modification.
INFECTION & TRANSMISSION : - Datalogs detailed Limit-115 as an airborne mutagenic virus with high transmissibility. Recent mass outbreak in Denver confirms those datalogs.
- Confirmed to spread via direct inhalation, contaminated water supply, and limited surface contact.
- Schematics suggest a slow incubation period of three to five days, ensuring rapid outbreaks in urban centers.
SYMPTOMS & EFFECTS : - Early-stage infection mimics conventional flu symptoms, causing fever, fatigue, and persistent cough.
- Progression leads to clogged respiration, sometimes causing asphyxia in some victims, alongside profuse and persistent sweating.
- Massive internal hemorrhaging in late-stage cases. Recent mass outbreak in Denver seems to confirm this late pathology.
MUTATION POTENTIAL : - Examined blueprints indicate that Limit-115 is not merely a bioweapon but also a mutagenic agent capable of genetic restructuring.
- Datalogs and other schematics suggest infection from Limit-115, and eventual recovery will render any survivor completely sterile, ensuring maximum efficiency of the bioweapon.
- The most concerning theory proposed by the datalogs: Limit-115 would apparently yield an extremely small chance (estimated at 0.3%) of causing complete DNA collapse and restructuration, leading to spontaneous mutations and structural evolution. Databanks briefly read by the squad and the presence of highly mutated creatures at the Lab seems to suggest there is some truth to this scary statement, although the current outbreak raging in Denver, Colorado Spring and Boulder has not yet shown any case of victims devolving into mutated abominations.
CONTAINMENT & WEAPONISATION : - Lab schematics outlined fail-safes for temporary viral suppression and harsh quarantine measures, indicating the U.S. military has not yet access to proper countermeasures to the infection.
- Evidence of aerosol dispersal systems suggests Limit-115 is intended for mass deployment in conflict zones.
- High-ranking officials within the Department of Homeland Integrity are listed as project overseers, signifying deep government involvement in its weaponization.
STRATEGIC ASSESSMENT & DIRECTIVES : - The temporary retrieval of three vials by the squad confirms the operational existence of Limit-115.
- The possible mutation factor presents a potential threat beyond standard bioweapons: future outbreaks could lead to unforeseen, uncontrollable consequences.
- The U.S. do not possess yet proper countermeasures. This gives Motherland some respite to find alternatives and start Immunity Projects.
- Operative commend immediate research into the adaptive properties of the virus and the possibility of repurposing it for strategic advantage.
Awaiting further orders.
END REPORT
ESP.TRADUIT:
绝密
战略行动组补充报告：限制-115分析 归档日期：2053年12月20日 归档地点：魍魉71基地 报告人：康佳乐少尉同志，负责战地医疗
初步研究结论： 尽管缴获样本全部遗失，小队仍通过845实验室的蓝图与数据日志确认： 限制-115为美军生物技术研究部开发的新一代基因武器，设计目的为快速瓦解人口结构并诱发长期基因变异。
感染与传播特性： - 限制-115是一种空气传播的高传播性致突变病毒。丹佛最近爆发的大规模疫情证实了这些数据。
- 确认通过直接吸入、受污染的供水和有限的表面接触传播。
- 潜伏周期较慢，为3-5日，确保了城市爆发隐蔽性
病理症状： 初期 类流感症状（发热/乏力/持续性咳嗽） 中期 呼吸系统黏液栓塞（部分病例窒息死亡）伴全身盗汗 晚期 系统性内出血（丹佛事件尸体解剖确认）
突变潜能： - 经检查蓝图，限制-115不仅是一种生物武器，而且是一种能够基因重组的诱变剂。
- 数据和其他图表显示感染了极限115，最终恢复将使任何幸存者完全不育，确保生物武器的最大效率。
-数据库提出的最令人担忧的理论：限制-115显然会产生极小的机会（估计为0.3%）导致DNA完全崩溃和重组，从而导致自发突变和结构进化。小组简要阅读了数据库以及实验室中出现的高度变异生物似乎表明这个可怕的说法有一定的真实性，尽管目前在丹佛、科罗拉多泉和博尔德肆虐的疫情尚未显示出任何受害者变成变异的可憎之物的情况。
遏制和武器化： - 实验室示意图概述了临时病毒抑制和严格隔离措施的不当，表明美国军方尚未获得适当的感染对策。
- 气溶胶分散系统的证据表明，限制-115是为在冲突地区大规模部署而设计的。
- 国土安全部的高级官员被列为项目监督员，这表明政府参与了其武器化。
战略评估与指示： - 小组临时回收了三个小瓶，证实了Limit-115的存在。
- 可能的突变因素构成了超越标准生物武器的潜在威胁：未来的爆发可能导致无法预见、无法控制的后果。
- 美国还没有适当的应对措施。这给了祖国一些喘息的时间来寻找替代方案并启动免疫项目。
- 执委会建议立即研究该病毒的适应性特性以及将其重新用于战略优势的可能性。
等待进一步命令。
汇报结束

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Dear [%],
Considering our recent... clashing interests, it might be appropriate to finally organize a proper... meeting, face to face, to finally solve the core of our common problem.
I thus invite you to join me at the old Poseidon Energy Research Facility, near the Western Vegas ruins. I am waiting for you, "Stealthtenza".
(Coordinates have been embedded in the disk)
ESP.TRADUIT:
亲爱的 [%]，
鉴于我们近期...的利益冲突，或许是时候安排一次正式的...会面了。面对面地，彻底解决我们共同的核心问题。
诚邀您前往西部维加斯废墟附近的旧海神能源研究设施一叙。静候您的到来，“隐身者”
（坐标已刻录在磁盘中）

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Date: 04/06/2077 Attending Physician: Doctor Emilius Pascal Location: Infirmary, Omicron Research Facility
Pr. Zerbina and Radcliff both solicited me today, each of them only two hours apart.
In both cases, similar symptoms: fever, clogged nasal cavities, cough and difficulties to breathe. Thanks God, I'm familiar enough with the Blue Flu to know those are only cases of common cold and not of the New Plague: we REALLY don't need an outbreak here at Omicron, especially now.
Prescribed treatment to both and asked them to stay in bed for a couple of days. I also ordered them to only resume their research down there once I have monitored their recovery and determined them to be in better shape.
Zerbina will cry that ALEXIARES and ANICETUS shouldn't suffer more delays, but management specifically requested a lockdown until all personal have successfully recovered. Told her she can return to the development of her fancy shield toys, but only once her symptoms disappear.
ESP.TRADUIT:
日期：2077年4月6日 主治医师：埃米利乌斯·帕斯卡尔博士 地点：奥米克戎研究设施医疗中心
今日泽比娜教授与拉德克利夫先后就诊，间隔仅两小时。
两者症状相似：发热、鼻塞、咳嗽及呼吸困难。所幸我足够熟悉"蓝流感"症状，可确定这只是普通感冒而非"新瘟疫"奥米克戎此刻绝不能爆发疫情。
给两人开了治疗处方，并要求他们卧床休息几天。我还要求他们，只有在我监测到他们的恢复情况并确定他们的身体状况有所好转后，才能继续进行研究。
特别备注： 泽比娜必会抱怨 阿勒克西阿瑞斯 与 阿尼刻托斯 项目进度延误，但管理层明确要求全员康复前实行封锁。已告知她只有症状完全消失后，才能继续捣鼓那些华而不实的护盾玩具。

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Date: 18/09/2077 Attending Physician: Doctor Emilius Pascal Location: Infirmary, Omicron Research Facility
Seems like there was an incident earlier in the afternoon during the field testing of Zerbina抯 newest trinket by Nellis servicemen. One of the test subjects was brought to the infirmary in an unresponsive state-cold and without vital signs.
I officially declared the subject clinically dead a few hours ago. Zerbina refused to provide any explanation, while Radcliff reluctantly stated that the soldier had come into direct contact with an exposed high-output electrical cable during the test, resulting in fatal neural and cardiac damage.
Autopsy has revealed that the subject entered a catatonic state following cardiac arrest induced by an abrupt surge of electrical energy. The heart sustained extensive thermal damage, exhibiting signs of severe coagulative necrosis, yet the remaining organs were largely unscathed. Notably, there were no visible external burns or dermal lesions consistent with high-voltage exposure.
I must admit that I have never seen a case similar to this in my entire career. Radcliff's explanation is coherent enough, but something is shoddy here.
ESP.TRADUIT:
日期：2077年9月18日 主治医师：埃米利乌斯·帕斯卡尔博士 地点：奥米克戎研究设施医疗中心
似乎下午早些时候，内利斯基地士兵在测试泽比娜教授的新设备时发生事故。一名受试者被送至医疗中心时体表无反应且温度低，已无生命体征：
经几小时观察后，正式宣告临床死亡。泽比娜教授拒绝提供任何技术说明，而拉德克利夫研究员不情愿地承认受试者接触了"裸露的高输出电缆"，导致了致命的神经及心脏损伤。
尸检发现，受试者遭遭电能骤升诱发心搏骤停，立即进入紧张性昏迷状态，其心脏遭受广泛性热损伤伴凝固性坏死，但其他器官无显著病理变化，但矛盾的是受试者体表无典型高压电击造成的皮肤焦化/树枝状纹路。
我必须承认，在我的整个职业生涯中，我从未见过这样的案件。拉德克利夫的解释很有条理，但有些地方有些粗劣。

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Date: 22/09/2077 Attending Physician: Doctor Emilius Pascal Location: Infirmary, Omicron Research Facility
Another day, another incident...
The news batch of soldiers that came from Nellis to test ALEXIARES got their share of bad luck it seems. Another casualty was brought to the infirmary soon after the test concluded.
Autopsy reveals a concerning absence of external trauma. However, internal findings were far more striking: every major organ of the poor soul seems to have collapsed and liquefied simultaneously. I need to conduct more examinations on the subject.
Zerbina and her assistant both told me the same story: their device malfunctioned during the live-combat test, an unexpected shutdown of the shield occurred, and a stray laser shot from one of the other testers sent the poor soul down to hell.
I don't like that.
I worked in the Emergency Medical Services of Wattz Electronics till 69: I know what laser-induced wounds looks like, and never have I seen intact bodies with dissolved soup inside be caused by anything remotely close to a Model-2000 or AER-9.
I swear to God, if I find proof they are developing Microwave or Plasma devices down there, I'm notifying management.
ESP.TRADUIT:
日期：2077年9月22日 主治医师：埃米利乌斯·帕斯卡尔博士 地点：奥米克戎研究设施医疗中心
新的一天，新的事故...
内利斯基地新调来的测试小队今天又出事了。就在阿勒克西阿瑞斯项目实战测试结束后不久，医疗中心接收了第二名死者。尸检结果显示体表完好无损，但内部器官却呈现出诡异的同步液化现象，就像有人把这可怜虫的内脏统统煮成了一锅浓汤。
泽比娜和她的助手众口一词，声称是护盾系统意外失效导致测试者被流弹击中。可我在瓦茨电子急救部干到69年，见过足够多的激光武器创伤案例。无论是M-2000还是AER-9型激光步枪，都不可能造成这种外皮完好而内脏融化的致命伤。
我得继续解剖检查。要是让我发现他们在底下偷偷研发微波或等离子武器......我向老天爷发誓，绝对会捅到管理层那儿去。

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Date: 28/09/2077 Attending Physician: Doctor Emilius Pascal Location: Infirmary, Omicron Research Facility
Another corpse brought to me. It's the third one this month
It's not an infirmary they are asking to maintain: it's a morgue.
Zerbina is running out of excuses: now she is incriminating the aggressor Gusty for malfunctioning during tests and asked management to disable all his combat subroutines.
I am not stupid. I have taken note of Radcliff抯 unease, the growing distress of Zerbina抯 assistant, and the increasingly erratic paranoia consuming Zerbina herself.
All the research terminals regarding ALEXIARES have been softlocked, and the patrol routines of the security bots have been rerouted to bar access to the research grounds downstairs. Worse, Zerbina now reacts with outright hostility, erupting into fits of rage if anyone dares attempt to descend there without her direct permission.
I've collected enough evidence through the last autopsies to conclude that the three dead soldiers died in similar accidents. Whatever it is, it was surely caused by ALEXIARES in one way of another...
ESP.TRADUIT:
日期：2077年9月28日 主治医师：埃米利乌斯·帕斯卡尔博士 地点：奥米克戎研究设施医疗中心
今天又送来一具尸体,这已经是本月第三例了。
他们要我维持的根本不是医疗中心，而是停尸房。
泽比娜的借口越来越站不住脚，这次竟把责任推给测试勇敢先生，声称它的战斗程序故障导致事故，还要求管理层禁用其所有作战模块。
我不是傻子。拉德克利夫的不安、泽比娜助手日渐加剧的焦虑，还有泽比娜本人愈演愈烈的偏执狂症状，这些我都看在眼里。
更可疑的是： 所有阿勒克西阿瑞斯研究终端都被软锁定 安保机器人的巡逻路线被重编程，封锁了地下研究区的通道 任何人未经泽比娜许可试图进入都会引发她的暴怒
通过三次尸检，我已确认这些士兵死于同类型事故。无论真相如何，阿勒克西亚瑞斯项目都脱不了干系......

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Date: 02/10/2077 Attending Physician: Doctor Emilius Pascal Location: Infirmary, Omicron Research Facility
This is devolving into insanity.
The number of victims amongst the test subjects is reaching absurd levels. We are losing almost one soldier per test, and Zerbina is not even trying to provide any plausible cause of death anymore.
It's the sixth death certificate she pressured me to falsify to send back to Nellis. This is madness.
Management is not replying to any of my pleas. My colleagues at Helios are silent too, and Radcliff will be transferred away in three days. Worse, Zerbina has monopolized all communications lines to contact Nellis directly.
My Hippocratic oath is at stake: I need to act before whatever kills those poor souls during the tests continue ripping its deadly toll. It's won't stop until Zerbina complete that forsaken project of hers.
If ALEXIARES and all those incidents were leaked to the public, management would be forced to close and shelve the project, right?
ESP.TRADUIT:
日期：2077年10月2日 主治医师：埃米利乌斯·帕斯卡尔博士 地点：奥米克戎研究设施医疗中心
事情正在滑向疯狂的深渊。
测试人员的死亡人数已经达到荒谬的程度，几乎每次测试都要折损一名士兵，而泽比娜甚至懒得再编造像样的死亡原因了。
这是她第六次胁迫我伪造死亡证明送回内利斯基地，简直丧心病狂。
管理层对我的所有申诉置之不理，太阳神的同僚们保持沉默，连拉德克利夫也将在三天后被调离。更糟的是，泽比娜垄断了所有通讯线路，直接与内利斯单线联系。
我的希波克拉底誓言正在被践踏：必须在那台杀人机器继续收割生命前采取行动。只要泽比娜的鬼项目不完成，这场屠杀就不会停止。
如果ALEXIARES阿勒克西阿瑞斯和这些事故被公之于众，管理层就不得不终止项目了吧？

ESP.ORIGINAL: Scientific Article: Self-Adjusting Fields and Plasma-Based Refractive Lattices for future shielding
ESP.TRADUIT: 《自适应力场与等离子体折射晶格：未来防护技术研究》

ESP.ORIGINAL:
[Self-Adjusting Fields and Plasma-Based Refractive Lattices for future shielding]
Publisher: Journal of Electromagnetic Society of America Author: Julia Zerbina et al, Commonwealth Institute of Technology Date: 07/12/2069
Abstract:
The advancements in the field of dynamic electromagnetism have opened new possibilities for protective technologies, particularly for military defense, aerospace, and civilian infrastructure. Amongst the most promising innovations are self-adjusting electromagnetic fields, which respond dynamically to external stimuli, and plasma-based refractive lattices, which manipulate ionized matter to control the flow of electromagnetic radiation. Combined, these systems offer the potential to replace traditional armor by providing flexible, adaptive shielding that reacts to both kinetic and directed energy threats in real time. Despite many advantages, these technologies present several challenges, including high energy consumption, stability concerns, and interference susceptibility. This paper will explore the underlying principles of these shielding systems, their current limitations, and their potential applications.
Introduction:
Traditional shielding relies on passive absorption or deflection mechanisms to mitigate physical and energy-based damage. While these methods are effective in many scenarios, they lack adaptability in dynamic environments where threats vary in intensity, frequency, and nature. Advances in electromagnetic engineering have led to the exploration of active shielding systems, which adjust their properties in response to external forces.
Two of the most promising concepts are self-adjusting electromagnetic fields, which alter their structure in real time to dissipate kinetic and energy-based impacts, and plasma-based refractive lattices, which use ionized matter to redirect or absorb electromagnetic radiation. These technologies promise significant improvements in protective systems but require substantial refinements before they can be implemented on a large scale.
Self-Adjusting Electromagnetic Fields:
The concept of self-adjusting electromagnetic fields is based on the ability of high-frequency oscillating electromagnetic fields to react to external forces. These fields are generated by a controlled small electromagnetic emitter, which produces a dynamic energy barrier that can be modulated in real time. When an impact is detected, the system adjusts its electromagnetic properties, altering factors such as amplitude, frequency, phase and polarization to counteract the incoming force. This dynamic adaptation allows a shield generated through it to dissipate kinetic energy, reducing the force of bullets, shrapnel, and nearly nullifying blunt trauma.
In addition to kinetic absorption, self-adjusting electromagnetic fields can also interact with energy weapons by disrupting the electromagnetic coherence of incoming beams. By modulating field intensity, the system can create localized electromagnetic interference, causing energy beams to scatter or lose coherence when reaching their target. However, the effectiveness of this method depends on the energy wavelength of the incoming attack, with some frequencies being more resistant to disruption than others.
The major challenge of self-adjusting electromagnetic shielding remains power consumption. The continuous generation and modulation of electromagnetic fields require a significant energy source, which limits the duration for which the system can remain active. Additionally, field harmonics must be carefully controlled to prevent resonance instability, which could theoretically lead to unintended field collapse. External electromagnetic interference from nearby electronic systems or strong magnetic fields could also compromise said shield integrity. Despite these challenges, self-adjusting electromagnetic fields remain a promising solution for real-time adaptive protection.
Plasma-Based Refractive Lattices
Unlike electromagnetic field shielding, which primarily interacts with kinetic and energy-based threats through repulsion and interference, plasma-based refractive lattices function by manipulating energy flow. Plasma consists of high-energy ionized particles that can be controlled using magnetic fields. When configured in a structured lattice, plasma can act as a dynamic refractive medium, bending and scattering electromagnetic radiation to prevent it from concentrating on a single point.
Plasma-based shielding works by generating a layer of ionized gas that interacts with incoming energy. When a directed-energy attack, such as a laser or microwave burst, reaches the plasma layer, the energy is refracted, diffused, or absorbed depending on the plasma抯 density and charge distribution. This mechanism provides a high degree of protection against thermal and energy attacks, as plasma is naturally inclined to absorb and dissipate heat. Additionally, since the plasma field is dynamic, it can be adjusted in real time to respond to changes in the intensity and frequency of incoming radiation.
However, the use of plasma as a shielding mechanism is not without limitations. Plasma density must be precisely controlled to maintain the correct refractive properties, and fluctuations in particle charge can cause inconsistencies in protection. If the plasma field is exposed to excessive energy input, it may become overloaded, leading to uncontrolled energy discharge or rapid dissipation of the shield. Additionally, plasma shielding requires a continuous power source to maintain ionization, making energy efficiency a critical concern.
Comparison of both Shielding Technologies:
Both self-adjusting electromagnetic fields and plasma-based refractive lattices provide unique advantages and limitations. Electromagnetic fields are highly effective at countering kinetic impacts and can disrupt some energy-based attacks, but they are vulnerable to electromagnetic interference and require precise modulation to remain stable. Plasma-based lattices excel at absorbing and redirecting energy, making them ideal for countering directed-energy weapons, but they are prone to density fluctuations and power constraints.
A hybrid approach that integrates both technologies may provide the most effective solution for adaptive shielding. By combining the kinetic absorption capabilities of electromagnetic fields with the energy dispersion properties of plasma lattices, a multi-layered defense system could be developed. Such a system would be capable of reacting to both ballistic and energy-based threats, dynamically adjusting its shielding properties based on the nature of the incoming attack. However, further research is needed to optimize energy efficiency, field stability, and scalability for practical applications.
Future Applications and Challenges:
The potential applications of self-adjusting electromagnetic fields and plasma-based refractive lattices extend beyond military defense. In aerospace engineering, plasma shielding could provide enhanced protection against cosmic radiation and meteoroid impacts, reducing the risks associated with long-duration space travel. In industrial hazard containment, electromagnetic field shielding could be used to protect sensitive equipment from electromagnetic hazard and thermal radiation. Additionally, adaptive shielding could play a role in medical technology, where controlled electromagnetic barriers might be used to contain harmful radiation or direct energy flow in precision treatments.
Despite these possibilities, significant challenges must be addressed before these technologies can be widely implemented. The high energy demands of both shielding methods remain a major obstacle, requiring advancements in compact energy sources and high-efficiency field generation. The issue of field stability must also be resolved, as fluctuations in electromagnetic harmonics and plasma density can lead to shielding inconsistencies. Furthermore, the interaction of these shields with external environmental factors, such as atmospheric conditions and electromagnetic interference, must be thoroughly studied to ensure their effectiveness in diverse settings.
ESP.TRADUIT:
自适应力场与等离子体折射晶格：未来防护技术研究
出版机构：美国电磁学会期刊 作者：茱莉亚·泽比娜等（联邦理工学院） 日期：2069年12月7日
摘要：
动态电磁学的最新突破正在重塑防护技术的范式。通过自适应电磁力场的实时动态响应特性与等离子体折射晶格对电磁辐射的精确操控，这两种技术协同作用可构建能同时抵御动能武器与定向能攻击的智能防护体系。尽管面临能耗过高、系统稳定性等技术瓶颈，其军事防御、航天工程及民用基础设施领域的应用前景仍极具革命性。
引言：
传统防护材料的被动防御机制已难以应对现代战争中多模态复合威胁。随着电磁工程的发展，具有环境感知能力的主动防护系统逐渐成为研究焦点。其中，基于量子传感网络的自适应电磁力场可通过毫秒级参数调整消解冲击能量，而磁约束等离子体晶格则能像棱镜般精确调控各类电磁辐射的传播路径。这两项技术的工程化应用将彻底改变现有防护体系的结构逻辑。
核心技术论述：
自适应电磁力场： 微型化电磁发射器生成的高频振荡场具有独特的动态重构特性。当探测到子弹或激光攻击时，系统能在300纳秒内完成频率-相位-偏振态的协同调制：对于动能武器，通过产生反向涡旋电磁场可将弹头冲击力衰减至原始值的5%以下；面对激光攻击，则通过制造局部相干性破坏使光束散射。但持续运行需消耗相当于小型城镇的电力，且强电磁干扰环境下易出现谐波失稳现象。
等离子体折射晶格： 在环形磁约束装置中，高温电离气体被塑造成周期性晶格结构。当微波或激光束穿透时，等离子体中的自由电子会与入射光子发生非线性相互作用——通过调节等离子体密度梯度，可使90%的激光能量发生全向散射。但大气压力变化会导致等离子体鞘层厚度波动，而超过临界值的能量输入更会引发热失控效应。
系统融合展望：
将电磁力场作为外层防御网拦截弹道武器，内层等离子体晶格专注应对能量攻击的混合架构，已在模拟测试中展现出显著优势。例如对"30mm穿甲弹+10kW激光"的复合攻击，该系统的整体拦截效率较传统装甲提升17倍。但双系统协同控制算法的实时优化、微型聚变供能装置的研发，以及战场复杂电磁环境下的稳定性验证，仍是亟待攻克的技术难关。
跨领域应用前景：
在深空探测领域，等离子体护盾可偏转90%以上的银河宇宙射线；医疗方面，精准调控的电磁力场能实现亚毫米级放疗定位；而工业级电磁屏障则可保护精密仪器免受核电磁脉冲损害。但当前原型机2.3吨的重量和15分钟的持续运行时间，距离实际应用仍有巨大差距。更值得警惕的是，这类技术的武器化可能引发新一轮军备竞赛，需国际社会建立相应的伦理审查框架。

ESP.ORIGINAL: ALEXIARES Shield System: Technical and Operational Manual
ESP.TRADUIT: 阿勒克西亚瑞斯护盾系统：技术和操作手册

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Introduction:
The ALEXIARES system is our next-generation energy shield developed as property of the Poseidon Energy Group for the specific purpose of enhanced battlefield survivability through personal and portable shielding. Unlike traditional body armor, which relies on physical materials for protection, ALEXIARES generates a self-sustaining energy barrier around the user, protecting it from kinetic impacts and providing energy weapons resistance. This document will provides a comprehensive explanation of the system's function, deployment, operational limitations, and maintenance requirements.
System Overview:
ALEXIARES operates through a compact shield generator, typically mounted on a user's belt harness, armor plating, or directly integrated power system. Upon activation, the generator projects a self-adjusting containment field around the user, forming an adaptive energy barrier. The shield is designed to dissipate kinetic force, absorb energy attacks depending on wavelenght, and provide temporary environmental hazard resistance. The shield automatically engages upon impact detection, meaning the system remains in low-power standby mode until an incoming force is registered. Once an attack is detected, the shield strengthens its protective field in the affected region, dispersing impact energy across the field's surface.
Technical Breakdown:
1) Self-Adjusting Electromagnetic Field: The core component of ALEXIARES is its self-adjusting electromagnetic field, which serves as the primary protective barrier. This field dynamically modulates its electromagnetic properties based on the type of incoming attack. The shield absorbs and disperses the momentum of physical impacts, such as bullets or blunt force, by redistributing energy across its surface and while it does not completely eliminate the force of an impact, it significantly reduces penetration and trauma. Incoming laser, plasma, or microwave radiation interacts with the shield抯 electromagnetic field, which alters its polarization to refract or absorb the energy and destabilize their structure, preventing concentrated damage in a single location.
The shield's green wave-like distortion effect results from rapid field oscillation adjustments, which become more intense in response to high-impact threats.
2) Plasma-Based Refractive Lattice In addition to its electromagnetic properties, ALEXIARES incorporates a plasma-based refractive lattice within the energy barrier. This layer is composed of ionized plasma particles suspended in a localized containment field, that assist in dissipating high-energy weapon impacts.
When an energy-based attack makes contact, the plasma lattice absorbs and refracts the incoming radiation, preventing full penetration. This secondary layer enhances protection against thermal and electromagnetic threats, allowing the user to resist lasers, plasma bolts, and others heat-based environmental hazards.
Power Supply and Duration:
ALEXIARES is powered by a high-capacity microfusion cell, which provides energy for limited-duration shielding. The generator is compatible with standard Microfusion Cells to provide between 5-8 minutes of continuous shielding before depletion or Poseidon Energy Compact Fission Battery (Prototype), to sustain the shield for extended durations, though not yet approved for field deployment. Due to high power demands, the shield cannot remain active indefinitely. Users are advised to conserve energy and engage the system only when necessary.
Failure Conditions and Overload Risks:
(This section seems to have been purposely and hastily erased)
ESP.TRADUIT:
引言：
ALEXIARES系统是波塞冬能源集团研发的新一代单兵护盾装置，旨在通过便携式能量屏障显著提升战场生存能力。与传统依靠物理材料的防弹装甲不同，该系统能在使用者周围形成自持型能量力场，有效抵御动能冲击与能量武器攻击。本文件将全面阐述系统功能、部署方式、操作限制及维护要求。
系统概述：
该护盾系统通过紧凑型发生器运作，通常安装在战术腰封、装甲外挂或直接集成至动力系统。激活后，发生器会投射出自适应约束力场，形成可根据威胁类型动态调整的能量屏障。该护盾具备动能分散、波长选择性能量吸收及短暂环境危害抵抗功能。 系统采用智能触发机制，平时保持低功耗待机状态，仅在检测到来袭攻击时立即激活。当遭受打击时，护盾会强化受击区域的力场强度，将冲击能量分散至整个力场表面。
技术细节：
1) 自适应电磁力场 作为系统的核心防御组件，该电磁力场能根据攻击类型动态调节电磁参数。面对子弹等物理冲击时，通过能量再分配显著降低穿透伤害；遭遇激光、等离子体或微波辐射时，则通过极化调制来折射或吸收能量，避免伤害集中于单点。护盾表面呈现的绿色波纹视觉效果正是其高频振荡调整的外在表现，在面对高强度威胁时波纹会变得更加明显。
2) 等离子体折射晶格 能量屏障内层包含等离子体折射结构，由约束场固定的电离粒子构成。当能量武器攻击接触时，该结构能吸收并折射辐射，有效抵御激光、等离子束等热基威胁，为使用者提供额外的保护层。
能源供应与持续时间： 系统采用高容量微型核聚变电池供能，标准型号可维持5-8分钟的持续防护。虽然也可兼容波塞冬能源实验型紧凑裂变电池以延长使用时间，但该配置尚未获准实战部署。鉴于较高能耗，建议使用者合理分配能源，仅在必要时激活系统。
故障条件与过载风险：
（该部分内容似乎被刻意且匆忙地删除）

ESP.ORIGINAL: ALEXIARES Functionality Test #21: Memo for the Speech
ESP.TRADUIT: 阿勒克西亚瑞斯能测试 #21：演讲备忘录

ESP.ORIGINAL:
03/10/2077 Agenda: MEETING AT 9 AM TODAY
Script: "Gentlemen of the United States Armed Forces, it is my pleasure to present to you..." - (Will women be there? Does calling it a pleasure take away from the project? Rewrite.)
"ALEXIARES! This revolutionary new device possesses the ability to provide thrice safety and security of Power Armor at the fraction of the cost!" - (Consider clarifying that the device is named after a Greek god of protection. Keep the reveal of the bigger prototype until the end of the meeting.)
"How does it work, you might ask? Well, using nothing but a battery the size of a plain microfusion cell, we have created a sort of force field, an energy shield even, that prevents any harm from coming to the user!" - (Don't clarify that it's more of a deflector screen than a fully absorbent energy shield. It works like a force field up until it's overloaded, and the Reds won't possess anything that can do that.)
"Now I know that the folks at National Electric have been making a fuss about energy costs during wartime, but what if I told you that, in only a little bit of time, that we can provide twice the power capability of the T-51's nuclear power pack, at an almost indefinite rate?" - (Confusing wording, but the customers don't need to worry. Consider removing naysaying from N.E.)
"If you'll come over to our testing chamber now, I'll be able to show you what it's capable of, and by the end of the test, you'll definitely want to hear more!" - (We've been testing for months now, I swear if another accident happens and another soldier dies during today's exercise...)
ESP.TRADUIT:
2077年10月3日 会议议程： 今日上午9时
讲稿： "美国武装部队的先生们，我很荣幸向各位展示——"（批注：现场会有女性军官吗？用'荣幸'会不会削弱项目严肃性？重写）
"阿勒克西亚瑞斯！这款革命性设备能以动力装甲几分之一的成本，提供三倍的安全防护！"（批注：记得说明这名字源自希腊守护神，大型原型机留到会议尾声再揭晓）
"您可能要问它的原理？听着，仅需一枚标准微型核聚变电池大小的能源，我们就能创造出某种力场或者说能量护盾，确保使用者毫发无伤！"（批注：别说明这只是偏转力场而非完全吸收式护盾，反正赤匪也没有能超载它的武器）
"我知道国家电力公司那帮人总对战时能源成本小题大做，但如果我说很快就能提供两倍于T-51核动力包的输出功率，而且近乎无限续航呢？"（批注：措辞混乱但客户不需要在意，建议删掉对国电的贬损）
"现在请移步测试场，您将亲眼见证它的威力——我保证演示结束后，各位会求着我继续讲解！"（内心独白：测试了几个月，今天要是再出事故死个士兵我他妈就完了）

ESP.ORIGINAL: Poseidon's Employee Security Recorder
ESP.TRADUIT: 海神雇员安全记录仪

ESP.ORIGINAL: Poseidon's Employee Security Recorder
ESP.TRADUIT: 海神雇员安全记录仪

ESP.ORIGINAL: Expunged Radio Report: #242
ESP.TRADUIT: 已删除的广播报告：242号

ESP.ORIGINAL:
[Date]: 2058
[Com Channel]: [X]: "Evil Storm" {Source: Wangliang 71} [Y]: "Motherland" {Source: Beijing} [Z]: "Moutain Rat" {Source: Unknown}
[X]: Evil Storm to Motherland, do you copy?
[Y]: UNTRANSCRIBED
[Z]: We will take over the transmission. Mountain Rat to Evil Storm, we will relay you to Motherland through us.
[X]: Well received. We are reporting increased activity around Nellis Air Force Base. New jets seem to be in testing there and the delivery of a platoon of Mister Gusties is being planned for next month.
[Z]: Copy that. Golden Tiger and New Typhoon have also reported turmoil in most Western American facilities affiliated to the Air force, will need to conduct more investigations.
[X]: Perfect then. Pass the info to Motherland and the other stations at once. Evil Storm out.
\\end of communication//
ESP.TRADUIT:
[日期]：2058年
[通讯频道]： [X]："邪风"{信号源：魍魉71基地} [Y]："祖国"{信号源：北京} [Z]："山鼠"{信号源：未知}
通讯内容： [X]："恶风暴呼叫祖国，收到请回复"
[Y]：未解码信号
[Z]："本台将接管通讯中转。山鼠呼叫邪风，通过我们建立与祖国的中继链路"
[X]："收到。内利斯空军基地周边活动激增，确认新型战机测试及排级勇敢先生机器人单位投送计划（预计下月实施）"
[Z]："受到。金虎与新台风同样报告了西海岸空军设施异动，需进一步侦查"
[X]："明白。立即将情报同步祖国及各站点。邪风完毕"
\\通讯终止//

ESP.ORIGINAL: To you, Zheng
ESP.TRADUIT: 写给你，郑

ESP.ORIGINAL:
//Roughly translated from: Chinese\\
My dear Zheng,
By the time you will read this message; I will be long dead. I抦 sorry for the pitiful spectacle you will have to witness, but after all this time, I don抰 expect your return anymore.
First and foremost, I want to apologize, and repent. All those years of defiance, of... contestation and hostility between us, all the slights wrongly perceived by me...
The truth was that I was jealous, Zheng. Jealous, and bitter.
Jealous of you, the little poster boy from the regular ground forces, so good and so brilliant that he was granted the honor of joining the Crimson Dragoons when me, Linyu, Min, Xiaru and the all others had to grovel and bleed our entire childhood to earn our own Hei Guei Warcloak!
Jealous of you, who were given executive command of MY Si Xiong, and turned it into the 揙h so more prestigious?Wu Xiong!
Jealous of you who were chosen as the test pilot for GUANYIN, the first moment the new model exited the production line...
I hated you Zheng. And even when shit hit the fan at the Dam, I, like always, blamed your leadership for what happened there.
We will all bring to our grave the horrors we saw down there. The... things, the abominations the Americans were creating at Sub-Level 1C... I will never forget their grin.
Even when they mauled Min, I cursed you. And when Linyu and Xiaru escaped with the vials only to be captured and executed by the enemy, I raged at the disaster your incompetence had brought on us all.
You had disappeared, left all of us scattered and to fend for ourselves. You were the one to blame, right?
Me? I retreated. Fled like a coward, ran until I reached Wangliang, and barricaded it for the next two decades. Took upon myself to train, organize and take care of those foreign allies that manned the bunker, working with them to complete that stupid bot program, sharing bread with them while slowly witnessing the world change outside.
I never got to see the high walls of Anchorage when our forces finally took it in 66, neither did I got the chance to lay my life with our brothers and sisters when we then lost the city in 77...
All I got to live was the world falling and the Earth burning, and even that... had to be more than 7000 miles from home.
I died in 53, Zheng. I died with Min, Xiaru, Linyu, and more than probably, you as well. None of us left the Dam, and I survived only to see my husk slowly erode deep inside Wangliang.
But it was for something, right? We served our country, made our parents, lovers, friends, the Party and even the great Charmain proud! We were the greatest Dragoon squad in a generation, surely our sacrifice wasn't in vain!
This belief kept me alive all this time, Zheng, up until I finally found the truth, buried deep in the archives of Wangliang. You will find it under the trap door in my room, there.
I can抰 live with it, but you? If you managed to survive that long, you will find in it an anchor to let our past, our blissfully ignorant loyalty to our accursed country behind.
What am I saying... You are dead Zheng. Long before I抦 writing all these words, most likely only a few minutes after we lost sight of you.
But... What if you were not?
What if, somehow, someway, you not only survived all these years, but also the fire of the nukes? And if you didn抰, what if something of you had survived in this now barren land?
Perhaps a child, or a trainee... Or just a spiritual successor?
All of us Dragoons were master assassins, unparallelled kings and queens of silence and demons of the shadows. But you? You were the best of us, and I抦 sorry I took me all this time to finally realize it.
Goodbye, Nao. Know that even as I drive my sword in my own heart, a true Dragoon's death, my last comforting thoughts will be this hope of mine that either you survived, or that you left something to inherit your mantle, and all our memories...
If our legacy as warriors can live on, I would like it to be through you or your scions than anyone else.
Someone who would have been your closest friend in another life.
Jiale Kang
PS: Before I die, just know I remotely reprogrammed our Vanguardist bots for them to physically search for you, should you never get the radio message I meant for GUANYIN. The Columnists will probably be surprised that the bots escaped the facility, but that's just a double insurance to find you.
ESP.TRADUIT:
//大致翻译自：中文\\
亲爱的郑：
等你读到这封信时，我早已不在人世。很抱歉让你看到这副狼狈模样，但经历了这么多，我早就不指望你能回来了。
首先我要向你道歉，为我这些年所有的对抗、争执和敌意，为我误解的每一次轻慢.....
真相是，郑，我在嫉妒你。嫉妒又愤懑。
我嫉妒你这个常规部队的模范生，优秀得能被破格提拔进赤龙部队——而我和林玉、敏、夏茹他们可是从小摸爬滚打，流血流汗才挣到那件黑鬼战甲！
我嫉妒你接管了我的"肆雄"小队，还把它改造成什么"更有威望的武雄"！
我嫉妒你能成为"观音"的首席试用员，新型号刚下线就......
我恨你，郑。就连大坝溃败时，我也像往常一样把责任推给你的指挥。
我们每个人都会把地下一层C区看到的恐怖带进坟墓。美国人培育的那些......怪物，它们咧开的嘴角我这辈子都忘不掉。
敏被撕碎时我在咒骂你，林玉和夏茹带着血清突围却被捕处决时，我还在痛斥你的无能害死了所有人。
你消失了，留下我们各自逃命。这都该怪你，对吧？
而我？我像个懦夫般逃往"魍魉"基地，把自己关了二十年。我开始训练、组织和照顾那些在地堡里工作的外国盟友，完成那该死的机器人程序，看着外面的世界一点点崩塌。
66年我军攻克安克雷奇时我没能见证，77年兄弟姐妹们死守城池时我也缺席......
我只能隔着七千英里，眼睁睁看着故土燃烧。
郑，其实53年我就死了。和敏、夏茹、林玉一起死在大坝，活下来的不过是具困在魍魉基地的空壳。
但这一切总该有意义吧？我们为国尽忠，让父母、爱人、战友乃至伟大领袖都为之骄傲！我们可是当代最强的龙骑小队，牺牲怎会白费？
这个信念支撑着我，直到......我在基地档案室发现了真相。资料藏在我房间的暗门下面。
我无法承受这个真相，但如果你还活着，它会帮你斩断过去，斩断我们对这个诅咒之国的愚忠。
我在说什么啊......你早就死了，郑。可能在我们失去你踪影的几分钟后就已经......
但... 万一呢？
万一你不仅活了下来，还躲过了核爆炸？
就算没有，会不会有你的血脉、学徒......或者精神继承者活在这片焦土上？
我们龙骑都是顶尖刺客，是阴影中的无冕之王。但你？你是最耀眼的那颗星，可惜我到现在才明白。
永别了，挠。当我以真正龙骑的方式将剑刺入心脏时，最后慰藉我的念头是：希望你还活着，或者有人继承了你的衣钵与我们的记忆......
如果战士的传奇必须延续，我宁愿它通过你或你的后裔来传承。
某个在另一个时空本该是你挚友的
——康佳乐
又及：临死前我远程改写了先锋机器人的程序，让它们搜寻你的踪迹（万一你没收到我发给观音的无线电）。虽然"总队队员们"会发现机器人逃逸，但这只是找到你的双重保险。

ESP.ORIGINAL: The TRUTH
ESP.TRADUIT: 真 相

[Corrupted Data]
[N]: What the hell was THAT?! We had a deal!
[Y]: We upheld our end of the bargain. Now it抯 time to uphold yours.
[N]: Don抰 play games with me! Your men weren抰 sent to sabotage the Dam, they were after Limit-115! Admit it! You used me!
[Y]: Used you? We warned you well in advance of our operation. You were handed classified dossiers on every member of the Wu Xiong before they even set foot on American soil, with twelve full hours to prepare your response. We gave you GUANYIN on a silver platter, and you still let it slip through your fingers, dear General.
[N]: You damn Chink! Do you realize what your men have done? This isn抰 just a security breach, it抯 a national health emergency! No... a pandemy! This is a disaster!
[Y]: A disaster for some. But not for you. Your decisive action at the Dam has earned you national praise, hasn抰 it? Even without GUANYIN, the classified intelligence we provided you on our Warcloak program is more than enough to secure your next promotion, if you present it as captured enemy intel, of course. And don抰 think our eyes aren抰 on you, General. We know about your little arrangement with Big Mountain抯 Research Division. We know you抮e trying to create your own Warcloak deadcopies. You owe us that second star.
[N]: So, it抯 blackmail now? Fine. What about my end of the deal? Completion of your damned bunker 揥angchinchong 85? Immunity from my jets at Nellis so your cargo planes can land and resupply the bunker. And...
[Y]: And full access to General Atomics second-generation robotics through your family's connections. Delivered directly to Wangliang 71.
[N]: Right. But tell me, Colonel... what抯 stopping me from cutting you off entirely? From turning that little shiny bunker of yours into a crater?
[Y]: Nothing. If you think you can get away with it. But consider this, General, what would happen if certain documents found their way into the wrong hands? Documents proving that Limit-115 is the true cause of the rampaging Blue Flu? That it was not a foreign bioweapon, but a creation of the United States Army抯 own Biotechnical Division? That you were one of its project overseers?
[N]: You wouldn't dare... You're bluffing!
[Y]: We both know that the full extent of the truth doesn抰 matter: only what people believe. So, General, shall we continue our business?
[Corrupted Data]
ESP.TRADUIT:
[日期]：2053年
[通讯频道]： [X]："邪风" {来源：魍魉71号基地} ||备用代理|| [N]：未知 {来源：莫哈维} ||定位：内利斯空军基地|| [Y]："祖国" {来源：上海} ||定位：特别行动部总部||
[数据损坏]
[N]：这他妈算什么？！我们明明说好的！
[Y]：我们履行了承诺。现在该你了。
[N]：少跟我玩文字游戏！ 你的人根本不是去破坏大坝，而是冲着限制-115去的！承认吧！你利用了我！
[Y]：利用？我们提前告知了行动细节，甚至在"武雄"部队踏上美国领土前12小时就向你提供了全员机密档案。连"观音"都拱手相送，结果亲爱的将军您还是搞砸了。
[N]：该死的黄皮佬！ 你知道你的人干了什么吗？这不仅是安全漏洞，是国家级卫生危机！不……是瘟疫！全完了！
[Y]：对某些人来说是灾难，但您除外。您在大坝的"果断行动"可是赢得了举国赞誉，不是吗？就算丢了"观音"，我们提供的"战甲计划"机密情报，只要您把它包装成缴获的敌情，也足够换来一颗将星。顺便提醒，我们很清楚您和"大山脉"研究部的勾当，也知道您在仿制战甲。这颗星，是您欠我们的。
[N]：所以现在是勒索？行。我的条件呢？你们那个破基地"王秦冲85号"的完工许可？内利斯空军对你们运输机的放行？还有……
[Y]：还有通过您家族关系提供的通用原子二代机器人，直送魍魉71号。
[N]：对。但告诉我，上校……我凭什么不直接切断合作？把你们那个铁罐头基地炸成弹坑？
[Y]：悉听尊便——只要您承担得起后果。不过将军不妨想想，如果某些文件意外曝光会怎样？比如证明"蓝瘟疫"的源头限制-115其实是美国陆军生物技术部的产物？再比如文件上恰好有某位项目监督人的签名？
[N]：你们不敢……虚张声势！
[Y]：真相从来不重要，重要的是人们相信什么。那么将军，合作继续？
[数据损坏]

ESP.ORIGINAL: Expunged Radio Report: #345

ESP.TRADUIT:
